🚀 Is Time Quantum? Well, this is WAY too much to be just a coincidence! Ok, so as I’m wrapping up my new book, "Quantum Lead", a groundbreaking study on quantum entanglement and time comes out! #youcantmakethisstuffup Published on May 10, 2024, in Physical Review, it’s called “Magnetic clock for a harmonic oscillator” by Alessandro Coppo, Alessandro Cuccoli, and Paola Verucchi. #talkaboutsynchronicity The study proposes a fascinating idea: that time operates consistently across both classical and quantum mechanics. Initially in a more quantum realm, when a critical mass of particles within each quantum system is reached, it transitions to behave according to classical physics. Why does this matter? It potentially solves the longstanding "problem of time" and suggests our macroscopic world operates under a unified framework of quantum entanglement. #bothand It implies everything we observe is interconnected—suggesting we are entangled with what we observe for it to be part of our reality. Moreover, it implies that everything we perceive where time progresses (think plants growing, flowers blooming, etc.) regardless of distance, is intrinsically linked to us. 🎩 H/T Page and Wootters (1983). Sound intriguing? Perhaps a bit baffling? Yep! It's the fascinating intersection of quantum mechanics and the essence of time with a dash of entanglement for good measure! If you're captivated by these synchronicities of the universe and want to better understand (read: #quantumphysicsmadeeasy) how this all works and how to make it work for YOU, the countdown to Quantum Lead is on!
